query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Quali per vetri trasparenti e tersi, 11 o ver per acque nitide e tranquille, 12 non sì profonde che i fondi sien persi,
13 tornan d’i nostri visi le postille 14 debili sì, che perla in bianca fronte 15 non vien men forte a le nostre pupille;
16 tali vid’ io più facce a parlar pronte; 17 per ch’io dentro a l’error contrario corsi 18 a quel ch’accese amor tra l’omo e ’l fonte.
query.result:
**English:**
10 As through transparent and clear glass, 11 or through clear and tranquil waters, 12 not so deep that the bottoms are lost,
13 the reflections of our faces return 14 so faint that a pearl on a white forehead 15 does not appear less strong to our pupils;
16 such I saw more faces ready to speak; 17 because of which I ran into the opposite error 18 to that which kindled love between man and the spring.
**Cornish:**
10 Kevel a-dreus gwydrow treus ha kler, 11 po dhe’m a-dreus dowrow kler ha siwel, 12 nyns dhe’n dowr byttegens na’n fondyow a wra kollys,
13 a wra owthwel an postilyow a’gan golwg 14 dhebel byttegens, byttegens na perl war tal gwyn 15 nyns a dheuth moy forth dhe’gan pupul;
16 kevel henna a welas ow moy fasow erel owth leverel; 17 rag dre henna ow rensas dhe’n gwall kontroel 18 dhe’n hyn a wra owth eneval karanteth ynter an den ha’n fenten.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 «Non ti maravigliar perch’ io sorrida», 26 mi disse, «appresso il tuo püeril coto, 27 poi sopra ’l vero ancor lo piè non fida,
28 ma te rivolve, come suole, a vòto: 29 vere sustanze son ciò che tu vedi, 30 qui rilegate per manco di voto.
query.result:
**English:**
25 "Do not wonder why I smile," 26 he said to me, "at your childish thought, 27 since your foot is not yet steady on the truth,
28 but turns you around, as usual, in vain: 29 what you see are real substances, 30 confined here for lack of a vow.
**Cornish:**
25 "Na wra owth owthmires rag owth owthsmilia," 26 ev a leveras dhe’m, "wosa’th pweryl koth, 27 wosa’th warbarth an gwir nyns yw’th tros na’th fid,
28 mes owth owthtro ow, kevel ow syw owthkolli, dhe voth: 29 substansow gwir yw an hyn a wra owth owthweles, 30 owth owthkolli ama rag mank a voth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Però parla con esse e odi e credi; 32 ché la verace luce che le appaga 33 da sé non lascia lor torcer li piedi».
query.result:
**English:**
31 Therefore speak with them and listen and believe; 32 for the true light that satisfies them 33 does not allow them to turn their feet away from it.
**Cornish:**
31 Rag hemma lever gansow ha klev ha kred; 32 rag an golow gwir a wra owth owthlowen 33 dhyworth y honan nyns a wra owth owthgallos aga trosow dhe owth owthdroi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E io a l’ombra che parea più vaga 35 di ragionar, drizza’mi, e cominciai, 36 quasi com’ uom cui troppa voglia smaga:
37 «O ben creato spirito, che a’ rai 38 di vita etterna la dolcezza senti 39 che, non gustata, non s’intende mai,
40 grazïoso mi fia se mi contenti 41 del nome tuo e de la vostra sorte».
query.result:
**English:**
34 And I, to the shade that seemed most eager 35 to speak, turned and began, 36 almost like a man who is burdened by too much desire:
37 "O well-created spirit, who in the rays 38 of eternal life feel the sweetness 39 that, untasted, is never understood,
40 it would be gracious of you to satisfy me 41 with your name and your fate."
**Cornish:**
34 Ha my dhe’n sketh a wra owth owthwel moy vagas 35 rag leverel, owth owthdroas ow, ha owth owthkomethas, 36 kevel den a wra owth owthkolli gans moy a-gan dhesir:
37 "O spyrys owth owthkre, pyw yn radnow 38 a byw bythowk a wra owth owthmos an dheles 39 pyw, nyns owth owthprovya, nyns yw owth owthkomprehendya byth,
40 hy a wra owth owthgras dhe’m syv owth owthkontentya 41 gans aga hanow ha aga sort".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
42 Ond’ ella, pronta e con occhi ridenti:
43 «La nostra carità non serra porte 44 a giusta voglia, se non come quella 45 che vuol simile a sé tutta sua corte.
query.result:
**English:**
42 And she, ready and with smiling eyes:
43 "Our charity does not shut the door 44 to a just desire, except like that 45 which wants its whole court to be like itself.
**Cornish:**
42 Ha hi, prest ha gansow lowen:
43 "Nyns yw serrys agan karita 44 dhe-ves just desyr, mes kepar ha'n 45 a vynna bos heveles y honan oll y lys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 I’ fui nel mondo vergine sorella; 47 e se la mente tua ben sé riguarda, 48 non mi ti celerà l’esser più bella,
49 ma riconoscerai ch’i’ son Piccarda, 50 che, posta qui con questi altri beati, 51 beata sono in la spera più tarda.
query.result:
**English:**
46 I was in the world a virgin sister; 47 and if your mind looks at itself well, 48 it will not hide from you that I am more beautiful,
49 but you will recognize that I am Piccarda, 50 who, placed here with these other blessed ones, 51 am blessed in the slowest sphere.
**Cornish:**
46 Yth oen gwyrysek worth y'n bys; 47 Ha'th poynt da wel yth poynt yn ta, 48 Ny wra'th cusul dhym bos moyha,
49 Mes yth aswonvos ow koweth Piccarda, 50 Nebes, set hwathma gans an erel sans, 51 Sans yw y'n sper vellow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Li nostri affetti, che solo infiammati 53 son nel piacer de lo Spirito Santo, 54 letizian del suo ordine formati.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Our affections, which are inflamed only 53 in the pleasure of the Holy Spirit, 54 are made joyful by the formation of his order.
**Cornish:**
52 Ny affectionow, neb a wra tanow 53 Mes y'n pleser an Spyrys Sans, 54 A wra lowen gans y'n furvow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 E questa sorte che par giù cotanto, 56 però n’è data, perché fuor negletti 57 li nostri voti, e vòti in alcun canto».
query.result:
**English:**
55 And this lot which seems so low down, 56 is given to us because our vows were neglected, 57 and vows in some way broken.
**Cornish:**
55 Ha'n sort ma a wra gwelys isella, 56 A wra gansow dhyn, rag ni wra gwythys 57 Ny votiow, ha votiow yn nebes le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Ond’ io a lei: «Ne’ mirabili aspetti 59 vostri risplende non so che divino 60 che vi trasmuta da’ primi concetti:
61 però non fui a rimembrar festino; 62 ma or m’aiuta ciò che tu mi dici, 63 sì che raffigurar m’è più latino.
query.result:
**English:**
58 And I to her: "In your marvelous aspects 59 there shines I know not what of the divine 60 that transforms you from your first concepts:
61 therefore I was not quick to remember; 62 but now what you tell me helps me, 63 so that it is easier for me to picture you.
**Cornish:**
58 Ha my a-dhi: "Y'nwedhow miraglus 59 A wra splanjys y'nwedhow nebes del 60 Neb a wra chanjya dhisoth an kynsa conceptow:
61 Rag henna, nyns oen prest dhe'm coffa; 62 Mes lemmyn, henna a wra gwaska dhys, 63 Ha'm wra moy esow dhe'm ymagynya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Ma dimmi: voi che siete qui felici, 65 disiderate voi più alto loco 66 per più vedere e per più farvi amici?».
query.result:
**English:**
64 But tell me: you who are happy here, 65 do you desire a higher place 66 in order to see more and to make yourselves more friends?
**Cornish:**
64 Mes lever dhys: why a wra lowen omma, 65 A wra'gas desira le unn le uhella 66 Rag gwell gweles ha gwell ober karow?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Con quelle altr’ ombre pria sorrise un poco; 68 da indi mi rispuose tanto lieta, 69 ch’arder parea d’amor nel primo foco:
70 «Frate, la nostra volontà quïeta 71 virtù di carità, che fa volerne 72 sol quel ch’avemo, e d’altro non ci asseta.
query.result:
**English:**
67 With those other shades she smiled a little first; 68 then she answered me, so joyful 69 that she seemed to burn with love in the first fire:
70 "Brother, our will is quieted 71 by the virtue of charity, which makes us want 72 only what we have, and does not thirst for anything else.
**Cornish:**
67 Gans an erel erel a wra lowen unn byghan; 68 Wosa henna a wra'm gorra moy lowen, 69 Ha'n wra gwelys ow tanow yn kynsa tan:
70 "Froer, nyns yw ny volonteth omma 71 Gwirvos a garita, neb a wra ober 72 Nyns mes henna a wra genen, ha nyns yw assetta."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 E ’n la sua volontade è nostra pace: 86 ell’ è quel mare al qual tutto si move 87 ciò ch’ella crïa o che natura face».
query.result:
**English:**
85 And in his will is our peace: 86 it is that sea to which all that she creates 87 or that nature makes moves.
**Cornish:**
85 Ha y'n y volonteth yw ny pes, 86 Henna yw an mor dhe neb oll a wra movyas 87 Neb a wra henna ober po neb a wra ober naturel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Chiaro mi fu allor come ogne dove 89 in cielo è paradiso, etsi la grazia 90 del sommo ben d’un modo non vi piove.
query.result:
**English:**
88 It was clear to me then, as fire, where 89 paradise is in heaven, and how grace 90 of the highest good does not rain down there in one way.**Cornish:**
88 Kler ommu dhymmoveleragveler 89 yn kever parres, ha'gas gras 90 a'gan ben ughella na wra dhyworth yn fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ma sì com’ elli avvien, s’un cibo sazia 92 e d’un altro rimane ancor la gola, 93 che quel si chere e di quel si ringrazia,
94 così fec’ io con atto e con parola, 95 per apprender da lei qual fu la tela 96 onde non trasse infino a co la spuola.
query.result:
**English:**
91 But just as it happens, if one food sates 92 and the appetite still remains for another, 93 which one desires and for which one gives thanks,
94 so did I with action and with words, 95 to learn from her what was the web 96 from which she did not draw the shuttle all the way.**Cornish:**
91 Mesheveleragveler, mar poos sawtya 92 ha poos aral remen an golon, 93 henna syw kerys ha henna syw gras,
94 hemma wrugav gans ober ha ger, 95 rag dyski dheworthi pyth o an gwlan 96 na wra dhyworthi an spolen bys yn fen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 «Perfetta vita e alto merto inciela 98 donna più sù», mi disse, «a la cui norma 99 nel vostro mondo giù si veste e vela,
100 perché fino al morir si vegghi e dorma 101 con quello sposo ch’ogne voto accetta 102 che caritate a suo piacer conforma.
query.result:
**English:**
97 "Perfect life and high merit in heaven 98 a lady higher up," she said to me, "according to whose rule 99 down in your world one dresses and veils oneself,
100 so that until death one watches and sleeps 101 with that spouse who accepts every vow 102 that charity conforms to his pleasure."**Cornish:**
97 "Bewnans perveth ha ughel renk yn kever 98 benen ughella," medhesa dhym, "gans pyth rewl 99 yn y'gan bys isella ha gwisk."
100 "Rag bys dhe'n mernans gwyly ha kows 101 gans henna prios a gemer oll lowen 102 henna karitas a wra dhe'n plesans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Dal mondo, per seguirla, giovinetta 104 fuggi’mi, e nel suo abito mi chiusi 105 e promisi la via de la sua setta.
query.result:
**English:**
103 From the world, to follow her, as a young girl 104 I fled, and in her habit I cloaked myself 105 and I promised the way of her sect.**Cornish:**
103 A'n bys, rag y hilynsi, ow polla 104 kerensa, ha yn y gwisk y'm kudhsa 105 ha'm promissa fordh y'gan sektys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Uomini poi, a mal più ch’a bene usi, 107 fuor mi rapiron de la dolce chiostra: 108 Iddio si sa qual poi mia vita fusi.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Men then, accustomed to evil more than to good, 107 snatched me away from the sweet cloister: 108 God knows what my life was like afterwards.**Cornish:**
106 Dus den, dhe'n ughella dhe'n da, 107 a wra'm gorra dhe'n kelli chi, 108 Duw a wydh pyth bewa bys ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 E quest’ altro splendor che ti si mostra 110 da la mia destra parte e che s’accende 111 di tutto il lume de la spera nostra,
112 ciò ch’io dico di me, di sé intende; 113 sorella fu, e così le fu tolta 114 di capo l’ombra de le sacre bende.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And this other splendor that shows itself to you 110 on my right side and that is kindled 111 by all the light of our sphere,
112 what I say of myself, she understands of herself; 113 she was my sister, and thus was taken from her head 114 the shadow of the sacred bands.**Cornish:**
109 Ha henna splannder aral a wra'th diskwedhes 110 dhe'n ow folen hag a wra tanow 111 gans oll goleudh agan sper.
112 Henna a wra leverel, henna a wra leverel; 113 hwra'ga'm hwor, ha hemma dell o'ga 114 a'ga benen a'n bendith benjyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Ma poi che pur al mondo fu rivolta 116 contra suo grado e contra buona usanza, 117 non fu dal vel del cor già mai disciolta.
query.result:
**English:**
115 But after she was turned back to the world 116 against her will and against good custom, 117 she was never loosed from the veil of her heart.**Cornish:**
115 Mes wosa henna dhe'n bys a wra treylyes 116 yn erbyn y hwyll ha yn erbyn da voes, 117 henna na wra gwrys a'ga golon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Quest’ è la luce de la gran Costanza 119 che del secondo vento di Soave 120 generò ’l terzo e l’ultima possanza».
query.result:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Così parlommi, e poi cominciò ‘Ave, 122 Maria’ cantando, e cantando vanio 123 come per acqua cupa cosa grave.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Thus she spoke to me, and then began singing ‘Ave, 122 Maria’, and singing vanished 123 like a heavy thing through deep water.**Cornish:**
121 Hemma a leveris dhym, ha ena wra kanna 122 ‘Ave, Maria’ kanna, ha kanna a wra 123 myns avel dour dowr traow trammyn dowr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 La vista mia, che tanto lei seguio 125 quanto possibil fu, poi che la perse, 126 volsesi al segno di maggior disio,
127 e a Beatrice tutta si converse; 128 ma quella folgorò nel mïo sguardo 129 sì che da prima il viso non sofferse;
130 e ciò mi fece a dimandar più tardo.
query.result:
**English:**
124 My sight, which followed her as much 125 as was possible, after it lost her, 126 turned to the sign of greater desire,
127 and turned itself wholly to Beatrice; 128 but that lightning flashed in my gaze 129 so that at first my face could not bear it;
130 and that made me slower to ask.**Cornish:**
124 Ow golwg, a wra'm sewi henna kemmys 125 hag o a alla, wosa henna a'm kolla, 126 a wra treylya dhe'n merk a vrassa hwyll,
127 ha dhe'n Beatrice a wra treylya oll; 128 mes henna a wra tanow yn ow golwg 129 hemma na alla ow fas dhe'n kynsa;
130 ha henna a wrug dhym bos mar dhe'n govyn.
